stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on Course 11’s Bowser-strike sequence: building Bowser’s office set, coding a functional elevator and doors, wiring new dialogue logic, and integrating Zeina’s Wiggler animations. He also showcased a visual overhaul of the earlier Cloud Ocean level, added an options menu, debugged physics issues, and brainstormed the next Wild West Valley stage.

development_findings.summary: Cloud Ocean level was visually reworked: slower cloud scroll speed, removed side mountains, lowered movable layer, added sky gradient and hanging stars to feel ‘near infinite’.
development_findings.quote: It looks so much more vast. It looks less like you’re caged in an old thing.

development_findings.summary: A new in-game options menu now allows toggling interlacing, Quick 64 mode (placeholder), and FPS limit. Disabling interlacing raises framerate by ≈25 %.
development_findings.quote: Do not turn interlacing off… but this increases frame rate by like 25 %.

development_findings.summary: Bowser’s Office area includes a Shy Guy receptionist, a waiting zone, and an elevator whose doors open/close when the player approaches and lift Mario upward.
development_findings.quote: When you go here the Shy Guy says… then this will be the elevator. There will be a door here that opens and closes when you come by.

development_findings.summary: Kaze coded the elevator door object, fixing issues where doors failed to move or re-close due to distance and action-state checks.
development_findings.quote: Why the fuck is it not moving?… It was waiting for the elevator to stand still, so I added a distance check of a thousand units.

development_findings.summary: Mission ‘Minion Strike’ design: minions protest outside; entering Bowser’s office triggers Bowser’s rant, then leaving removes the strike and summons an oil-monster boss.
development_findings.quote: Bowser’s gonna talk about how he’s gonna send a strike breaker… then the big oil monster comes and eats you.

development_findings.summary: Zeina delivered a full Wiggler animation set (idle, talk, angry, stomp-off). Kaze implemented multi-cylinder hitboxes and context-sensitive dialogue that changes as sabotage tasks are completed.
development_findings.quote: Every time something goes wrong the dialogue is no longer available, so it gives you a hint as to what to do next.

development_findings.summary: Four sabotage sub-tasks for the Wiggler star: disrupt glass-pane Koopas, distract cement watcher, bother Goomba on lunch break, and push waiting Thwomps; Wiggler comments on whichever is still active.
development_findings.quote: One of my guys has been on a lunch break for a while, mind checking on him… Someone should give those Thwomps a push.

development_findings.summary: Bug investigation: Toxbox objects gradually sank because gravity kept reducing Y-velocity; Kaze printed object-home values and traced it to unintended gravity application added for protest scene.
development_findings.quote: Every step they take they go slightly down… the gravity kept decreasing its y-velocity until it fell through the floor.

development_findings.summary: Badub composed new layered music for Bowser Level 2: two channels muted create indoor mix; an extra channel enabled gives outdoor mix.
development_findings.quote: It’s composed so you can disable two channels and you get an indoors version and enable another channel to get an outdoors version.

development_findings.summary: Wild West Valley (next course) is scoped: cowboy enemies, wanted posters, Dry Bones sheriff boss, scavenger-hunt star, red coins, 8-bit pipe. All six stars planned.
development_findings.quote: It’s gonna be so scenic… scavenger hunt fits the Wild West theme… all six stars are already kind of decided.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers September releases because Nintendo take-downs are less likely then.
context_findings.quote: I like to release my games around September… least likely Nintendo’s gonna take them down.

context_findings.summary: He plans to sell physical boxes/manuals with QR links, not cartridges, to avoid litigation.
context_findings.quote: I’m not gonna make a physical cartridge… but I might make a box and an instruction booklet and sell those as merch.

context_findings.summary: Discussed struggle obtaining a mortgage; father-in-law may co-sign to save ≈$20 k in taxes; hopes to stream from a basement ‘bunker’.
context_findings.quote: I actually can’t get a loan right now because my income is too low… but we can afford the house.

context_findings.summary: Explained YouTube Shorts strategy: pays editors $5 per short, posts weekly, hopes occasional viral shorts offset cost.
context_findings.quote: My hope is that one of these shorts takes off… that one paid for three shorts.

context_findings.summary: Philosophical talk on AI: sees potential for monopolization if big companies lock training data; worries about creative futility when AI surpasses humans.
context_findings.quote: If the one thing that you as a human are good at can just be done by something else, doesn’t it feel futile to learn a skill?

context_findings.summary: Comments on full-time gamedev job: lower pay than other programming fields; started professional work only a year ago, not yet ‘senior’.
Shows preference for “background-noise” long-form videos over concise shorts; actively plans content calendar.
context_findings.quote: People don’t want a video that’s concise and to the point; they want background noise.

biobak.summary: Gave visual critique of Cloud Ocean update, affirming it feels larger and suggesting child’s-room intro pan.
biobak.quote: It looks so much more vast… remove the Yoshis from the cardboard; maybe build a whole bedroom around it.

biobak.summary: Provided dialogue line ideas for Wiggler sabotage hints (‘One of my guys has been on a lunch break…’).
Suggested QR code inside physical game box that links to download.
biobak.quote: We can make it QR-scannable… just print the link inside the box.

badub.summary: Submitted new multi-layer Bowser level track designed for indoor/outdoor channel switching.
badub.quote: It’s for the second Bowser level… you can disable two channels for indoors and enable another for outdoors.

zeina.summary: Delivered new Wiggler animation set (base, angry, talk, stomp); also working on Bowser sitting and tantrum cycles.
zeina.quote: I’ll be the best animator on this project… Wiggler’s animation was harder than Bowser’s walk cycle but I finished it faster.

zeina.summary: Confirmed face-texture and bone-order issues with Wiggler model that Kaze resolved.

key_stories.title: Elevator Door Bug Hunt
key_stories.summary: Kaze coded Bowser office elevator doors but they refused to move and re-close properly. Through live debugging he discovered the logic waited for zero velocity and lacked a distance check, causing stalls.
key_stories.challenge: Doors did not slide after Mario exited elevator.
key_stories.process: Printed action states, added distance > 1000 check, separated variables, moved object in proper action states.
key_stories.outcome: Elevator now opens, lifts, and re-closes reliably; forms core of office sequence.
key_stories.key_quote: Why the fuck is it not moving?… so I added a distance check of a thousand coordinates.

key_stories.title: Cloud Ocean Makeover
key_stories.summary: An older level felt cramped. Kaze slowed cloud movement, removed mountains, deepened sky gradient, and lowered horizon. Biobak confirmed it now feels expansive.
key_stories.challenge: Level looked small and enclosed like Bob-omb Battlefield size.
key_stories.process: Adjusted texture scroll speed, deleted side geometry, added gradient and stars.
key_stories.outcome: Stage appears ‘near infinite’ and performance improved (25 fps minimum).
key_stories.key_quote: Now it looks near infinite and the mountains on the sides are gone.

key_stories.title: Wiggler Supervisor Star
key_stories.summary: Zeina’s new Wiggler model enabled Kaze to script a multi-phase sabotage mission where dialogue reflects remaining tasks.
key_stories.challenge: Need engaging star with guidance but freedom.
key_stories.process: Defined four sabotage targets; wrote dynamic text; implemented dual-cylinder hitbox; integrated animations.
key_stories.outcome: Star now provides adaptive hints and showcases new animations.
key_stories.key_quote: Every time something goes wrong the dialogue is no longer available, so it gives you a hint what to do next.

key_stories.title: Future Wild West Valley Brainstorm
key_stories.summary: Team sketched Course X: cowboy enemies, Dry Bones sheriff boss, scavenger hunt, themed visuals.
key_stories.challenge: Next course needs fresh theme and gameplay.
key_stories.process: Group chat ideation; listed star concepts; assigned asset needs (wanted posters, cowboys).
key_stories.outcome: All six stars outlined; Biobak to design wanted posters.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s gonna be cowboys… scavenger hunt fits the Wild West theme; all six stars are already decided.
